title: Shrimp with Tomatoes, Capers, and Lemon
introduction: Shrimp with Tomatoes, Capers, and Lemon is one of those quick and adaptable dishes that epitomize the brilliance of Italian cuisine. This delicious and speedy main dish can be enjoyed as it is, or you can elevate it by tossing it with pasta and extra-virgin olive oil for a more filling meal.
ingredients: 1 pound medium shrimp, peeled and deveined
1 pint grape or cherry tomatoes, halved or quartered if large
instructions: In a 10-inch skillet, heat the oil over medium-high heat. Add the shrimp, garlic, and a pinch of salt. Cook until the shrimp turn pink and lightly golden, about 1 to 2 minutes per side. Transfer the shrimp to a plate.

Add the tomatoes and capers to the pan. Cook, stirring frequently, until the tomatoes are slightly softened, about 2 minutes. Return the shrimp to the pan and add the parsley and salt to taste. Stir well and cook 2 minutes more.
Add the lemon zest. Discard the garlic and serve immediately.
